titleInfo.title: [Letter] 1838 Jun. 16, Rural Rest [to] Henry King, Koss Landing, Tennessee / Ja[mes] M. King

mods.abstract: This is a letter dated June 16, 1838 from James King to his son, Henry King. He praises his son for his achievements as a volunteer in the army and is grateful for the letters Henry has written to him. He urges him to write with more information on army movements and other inside information.

location.physicalLocation: Middle Tennessee State University. Albert Gore Research Center
